summary.title: StellarPay Digital Banking Threat Model (PayPal-Based)
summary.description: StellarPay Digital Banking is a web-based digital payment platform, modeled after PayPal, enabling users to create accounts, link bank cards, send/receive money, pay for goods/services, and manage transactions in real time. It handles sensitive data including personal identification details, bank account information, transaction logs, and API communications with payment gateways, requiring robust security measures

diagrams.title: StellarPay (PayPal-Based)

data.name: Web Application
data.description: Handles user inputs and displays transaction pages

threats.title: The attacker may spoof the user’s identity to access the accounts.
threats.description: The attacker may spoof the user’s identity to access the accounts.
threats.mitigation: I would suggest the implementation of Multi-Factor Authentication such as the utilization of app-based tokens like the Microsoft Authenticator App, the enforcement of string password policies, the configuring of account lockout from failed login attempts. Additionally, real-time management can be implemented for suspicious login patterns such as geolocation anomalies and the utilization of Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system.

threats.title: The attacker may inject malicious code through user inputs (SQL injection)
threats.description: This can occur when a fake backend server is set up which tricks the system into accepting fraudulent transaction requests
threats.mitigation:
Technical Controls: At the Web Application layer, I would suggest the implementation of input validation and sanitization along with the installation of a Web Application Firewall (WAF) to detect and block malicious inputs. Additionally, there should be regular updates to frameworks and libraries.
Administrative Controls: A patch management policy should be put into place with monthly reviews and there should be a mandate on code reviews for all input handling code.

threats.title: The user may deny having performed a transaction and the system has poor logging.
threats.description: The user can deny having authorized a transaction and the system may not be able to prove otherwise due to having inadequate logging, allowing the user to claim on the value of the transaction.
threats.mitigation:
Technical Controls: For vulnerabilities regarding this threat, I would recommend the implantation of detailed transaction logging with timestamps, IP addresses, and user ID’s, the use of digital signatures on all transaction records, and the storage of logs in tamper resistant databases.
Administrative Controls: There should be an implementation of a logging audit policy which has frequent reviews and staff responsible for this should be trained on log integrity maintenance.

threats.title: The user may face the disclosure of bank account information by an attacker.
threats.description: Bank details of the user may be exposed to an intended target as a result of a breach or weak controls.
threats.mitigation:
Technical Controls: As a measure for this, it is important to use strong encryption, especially for the database fields. Encryption such as AES-256 is a good encryption mechanism to use, alongside restriction of database access to authorized personnel via RBAC (Role-Based Access Control). Furthermore, there should be a regular rotation of encryption keys using a secure key management system.
Administrative Controls: Penetration tests should be performed more frequently and there should be a strengthened policy regarding shared amin accounts.

threats.title: StellarPay may experience a DDoS attack which overwhelms the web application which would subsequently disrupt the service.
threats.description: This is when attackers overload the server with traffic which makes the service unavailable to legitimate users.
threats.mitigation:
Technical Controls: There should be implementation of rate limiting at the Web Application level and the deployment of DDoS protection services such as AWS Shield or Cloudflare. Additionally, it is vital to configure load balancing across multiple serves for enforced redundancy.
Administrative Controls: I would recommend the development of a stringent incident response plan for DDoS attacks alongside an increased frequency of stress testing that is aligned with business needs to ensure optimal levels of availability of the service.

threats.title: The attacker may gain administrative access to the platform.
threats.description: An attacker may exploit the weaknesses of the system to gain unauthorized administrative access of the system
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

data.name: Database
data.description: Stores User Personal Details, Bank Account Info, Transaction Logs

labels:
Store Data 
(Encrypted)
Signed and Tamper-
Resistant Logs

diagrams.description: Assets like User Personal Details and Bank Account Information, as seen in PayPal, are prioritized due to GDPR/PCI-DSS compliance and high fraud risk. The scope includes entry points (User Interfaces, APIs) to address attack surfaces like phishing, data flows to secure transmissions (e.g., payments via HTTPS), and trust boundaries to enforce controls like firewalls and TLS, mirroring PayPal’s security approach for StellarPay.
